title: In situ measurement evidence of selective aqueous-phase formation of ammonium, nitrate, and sulfate in clouds
abstract:
•Cloud processes promoted the aqueous-phase formation of secondary inorganic ions. •In-cloud enrichment of secondary inorganic ions shows particle-type dependence. •Ammonium and nitrate showed ubiquitous enrichment across four types of particles. •Enrichment of sulfate was restricted to K-rich and Metal particles. 
 To better understand the in-cloud enrichment of secondary inorganic ions, the chemical composition of individual particles during cloud events and cloud-free periods, as well as cloud water and PM2.5 samples, were measured from August to September 2023 at Mt. Damaojian (1128 m a.s.l.) in southeastern China. Our results demonstrated that cloud processes promoted the aqueous-phase formation of ammonium, nitrate, and sulfate, but the degree of sulfate enrichment was lower than that observed for ammonium and nitrate. Furthermore, the average hourly relative peak area (RPA) of secondary inorganic ions revealed their selective enrichment in cloud droplets. The RPA of ammonium, nitrate, and sulfate in cloud droplet residual (RES) particles were 5.11, 3.05, and 1.43 times greater than those in cloud interstitial (INT) particles during two consecutive long-lasting cloud events, respectively. Both ammonium and nitrate showed ubiquitous enrichment across all particle types, including K-rich, Black carbon (BC), Metal, and Sea salt (SS) particles, although with distinct degrees of enrichment. Ammonium exhibited the highest degree of enrichment in the SS particles, whereas nitrate showed the most pronounced enhancement in the BC particles. Notably, the RPA of nitrate in all four types of particles exhibited a significant positive correlation with the liquid water content (LWC), reinforcing the role of aqueous-phase processing. Unlike ubiquitous ammonium and nitrate, sulfate enrichment was restricted to K-rich and Metal particles. The different enrichments of ammonium, nitrate, and sulfate underscore particle-specific influences on their in-cloud formation. These findings extend our current understanding of atmospheric chemistry in clouds.

explanation: 该论文主要关注数值天气预报模型的降水预测性能评估，特别是在青藏高原东部地区。它评估了不同模型（CMA-GFS, ECMWF, NCEP-GFS, CMA-MESO, CMA-SH9）在2021年汛期的表现，并分析了它们在不同天气类型和季节中的预测能力。研究重点在于模型对强降水事件的预测准确性，以及它们在捕捉对流和锋面系统方面的能力。虽然该研究与大气过程有关，但它并不直接涉及大气环境遥感技术，如空气质量监测、卫星观测或大气成分分析。因此，它与大气环境遥感技术的关联性较低。
authors: Zhipeng Wu;Yan Zhang;Chunmei Hu;Chengzhi Deng;Juan Luo;Shenggang Wu;Yingying Zhou;Hong Zhang;Zhiyi Liao;Huan Wang;Yue Pang
title: Multi-model verification and evaluation of precipitation forecasts and Southwest China Vortex Rainstorms in Eastern Tibetan Plateau
abstract:
•Model Performance Benchmark: First systematic evaluation of five operational models (CMA-GFS, ECMWF, NCEP-GFS, CMA-MESO, CMA-SH9) during the 2021 extreme flood season in the eastern Tibetan Plateau, combining objective metrics and forecaster assessments. •Key Divergences Identified: The results indicate that mesoscale models with higher horizontal resolutions exhibit certain advantages in predicting heavy rainfall. Nevertheless, ECMWF demonstrates a well-balanced performance in precipitation forecasting. •Operational Advantages: CMA-SH9 achieves highest accuracy in spring heavy rainfall positioning. CMA-MESO best captures convective initiation for cold air-involved SWV/frontal systems despite higher false alarms. •Practical Implications: Findings directly inform forecast model selection for different weather regimes in this high-risk region, with mesoscale models proving critical for nowcasting extreme events. 
 This study systematically evaluates the performance of five operational numerical models (CMA-GFS, ECMWF, NCEP-GFS, CMA-MESO, and CMA-SH9) during the 2021 flood season in the eastern Tibetan Plateau. Combining traditional verification metrics ( Threat Score score, false alarm ratio, missing ratio) with subjective synoptic evaluation by forecasters, we assess model performance across seasons, months, and weather types, with particular focus on 22 severe rainfall events. Key findings include: 1) ECMWF demonstrates superior performance for light-to-moderate precipitation, while CMA-MESO and CMA-SH9 show better skill in heavy rainfall prediction, with assimilation systems significantly improving short-term (≤12 h) forecasts; 2) compared to its global counterpart, CMA-MESO demonstrates notably reduced surface temperature errors through its upgraded land data assimilation system.; 3) CMA-SH9 and CMA-MESO outperform ECMWF in positioning spring heavy rainfall events and capturing convective-scale features, though CMA-MESO's higher false alarm rates reduce its objective scores; 4) for frontal systems and southwest vortex events with cold air involvement, CMA-MESO provides the most accurate convective initiation locations and echo patterns.

explanation: 该论文主要研究闪电X射线的产生机制，重点分析了光学辐射、甚高频辐射和回击间隔等因素对X射线产生的影响。研究结果表明，领导分支可能会阻碍X射线的发射，回击间隔的延长有利于更高能量X射线的发射。该研究支持领导端高场失控电子机制是闪电X射线产生的原因。虽然闪电与大气电过程有关，但该论文的重点不在于大气环境遥感技术，如空气质量监测、卫星观测或大气成分分析，因此与大气环境遥感技术的关联性不强。

title: Potential criteria for the generation of lightning X-rays: Optical and VHF radiation, and interstroke intervals
abstract:
•Observations confirm leader branches may impede X-ray emission for the first time. •X-ray and VHF radiations exhibit a robust correlation in both timing and intensity. •Lengthening the interstroke interval facilitates higher-energy X-ray emission. •X-ray radiation likely originates from the leader tip high-field runaway electron mechanism. 
 On July 18, 2023, an altitude-triggered lightning flash, consisting of thirteen leader/return stroke (LR) sequences, was successfully induced. X-ray emissions were detected during seven of these LRs. This study comprehensively analyzes the differences in optical radiation, VHF radiation, and interstroke intervals between LRs that were accompanied by detectable X-rays and those that were not, with the aim of exploring the underlying mechanism of X-ray production in lightning. For the first time, experimental observations confirm that leader branches may impede the emission of X-rays, likely due to a reduction in the potential difference at the leader tip. Additionally, a significant temporal synchronization and notable intensity correlation were observed between X-ray emissions and VHF radiation, both of which exhibit a strong positive correlation with the intensity of the electric field at the leader tip. In the studied lightning event, detectable X-ray emissions occurred only when the interstroke interval exceeded approximately 20 ms. More importantly, our results demonstrate that longer interstroke intervals promote the generation of higher-energy X-ray emissions. Both the total X-ray energy and the mean photon energy showed a positive correlation with the interstroke interval, with Spearman correlation coefficients of ρ = 0.685 and ρ = 0.595, respectively. This enhanced X-ray emission is attributed to the stronger electric field developed at the leader tip during longer interstroke intervals. Collectively, these findings provide strong support for the leader tip high-field runaway electron mechanism as the origin of lightning X-rays.
